Due to some performance testing requirements we need to check which user accessed which report and if he has drilled down to a particular level in a report, then there should be a means to know that as well. BO offers a few standard activity reports to check which user has done which activity. However the details of drill down etc. cannot be checked using that. Please help as to how can we check that too. Best Regards, Neha

data.title: AA: which  depr. area should post real time and which periodically

qas.question: Hi, according to group rules IFRS depr.area shall post real time and local trade law (ROC) periodically. But there is a request from India that ROC should post real time and IFR. Is there a legal requirement? How multionalals sove such problems? Thanks BR Tarik

answers.text: The requirement toi post to Books of accounts is there as per ROC. The real time posting is not there. So you can create a depreciation area which posts on a periodical base to the books of accounts.

data.title: There are 2 places to define Company Code, which is correct.

qas.question: There are 2 places to define company code i.e.: IMG -> Enterprise Structure -> Definition -> Financial Acc -> Define Company, and IMG -> Enterprise Structure -> Definition -> Financial Acc -> Edit, Copy, Delete, Check Company code. I know the one path updates table T001 and the other T880 but I don't understand the differences... probably as I am abapper. Edited by: Gemini Twin on Jun 15, 2011 10:43 AM

answers.text: Hi Gemini, Company and Company Code are different. The first path is to define Company: IMG -> Enterprise Structure -> Definition -> Financial Acc -> Define Company Second path is to define Company Code: IMG -> Enterprise Structure -> Definition -> Financial Acc -> Edit, Copy, Delete, Check Company code. (the practice when creating any new config in SPRO is to used Copy function instead of Create) We can make do without Company. In my customer's system, we do not set up Company. Company Code is a must and is the first step that you need to define before defining anything else (Pers Area, PSA, etc). Chart of Account also linked to Company Code, not Company. The two are different, please do not confused them into one.

answers.text: Dear, Please use the table FAGLFLEXT in ECC 6 or GLT0.

data.title: invoice not blocked for payment by inspection lot which created with HU

qas.question: Dear all, I have a scenario where I don't want to process the payment if Quality lot is not cleared or rejected. I understand this can be done by using control key 0007 and ticking the QM in procurment in QM view of Material master. I have done this and it does work if the inspection lot creating by MIGO with inspection type 01 generally. But, if the inspection lot creating via inbound delivery packing(we are using wm and HU),it doesn't work. Please let me know if you have any information about this. Thank you! BRS Murphy

answers.text: SAP NOTE 2160191 - QM in procurement with Handling Units:You want to use QM in procurement and also Handling Units Management, but the combination does not work together.

data.title: Creating Contract with dummy material which we don't want copied

qas.question: Hi, We have a situation where we wish to use a contract so as to set the partners for susequent orders for a Customer. (The customer has many ship-to's and many specal defined partners (their customers) of which we want only one of each for a construction project) The pricing of materials is performed on Product hierarchy via sales deals and actual sales line items are unknown until the creation of the sales order with reference to the contract. We therefore are creating a contract with a dummy material (you cannot create the contract without this material) and unfortunately this is copied into the subsequent orders. My question is, is there anyway apart from the Customer services department flagging the item for deletion to create the order without the material from the contract.

answers.text: Hi, It sounds weird why you would not want the item copied into subsequent Orders. Probably is the nature of the business that you are facing. For your queries, in VTAA copy control, in the entry of Source doc (Contract) to Target doc (Order) and the ItemCategory used, you may want to change your Copying Requirement routine from "303" (Standard - Always an Item) to "302" (Do Not Copy Item).. This way, it will not copy the item of your Contract to the subsequent Order. Hope this helps. Thanks. Rgds. Edited by: PKW on May 6, 2010 9:01 AM

And found that it should be unassigned from delivery before the delivery can be deleted. But I am not aware on how to do it. data.title: How to repay Investment Support on the asset? thru which TTY?

qas.question: Hello guys, Have anyone used TTY J01/J02 to repay investment support? Because SAP does not allow you to configure custom TTYs under tcode AO83 for repayment of invest. supprt. and J01/J02 uses TTy group 52 "Extraord. write-off invest supprt" which gets classified as unplanned depreciation under Area 41 instead of reducing the Investment support posted under same area 41. Is this the correct way of repaying/refunding? If not, what TTY to use to refund or repay the support (either partially or fully) and if there is any way to customize TTY specially for repaying/refunding this support. Open for any suggestions. Thanks, Kartik.

answers.text: Hi : ) I know this thread is quite old, but I recently had the same problem as Kartik and was able to change an automatically created transaction Type eg. I, J and K using transaction AO73_INV. This allowed me to copy transaction type K and I was able to configure my own transaction type for investment support which now allows posting of investment support refund without the retirement of the asset and reduces the amorisation as expected. Hope this helps : ) Tanja

data.title: Which BF or UserExit we have to activate to use Single-Unit Batches?

qas.question: Hello everybody, there is the possibility to use Single-Unit Batches with SAP Mill products: https://help.sap.com/saphelp_erp60_sp/helpdata/en/cb/cdc353b677b44ce10000000a174cb4/content.htm https://help.sap.com/saphelp_erp60_sp/helpdata/en/cb/cdc353b677b44ce10000000a174cb4/content.htm We have SAP Mill, but something need to be activate, because we don't have the field XPCBT in the table MCH1, here under the first .append: http://www.se80.co.uk/saptables/m/mch1/mch1.htm http://www.se80.co.uk/saptables/m/mch1/mch1.htm We know this, but we can't use it: http://help-legacy.sap.com/saphelp_erp2005/helpdata///EN/81/0bc93a5fc1093ee10000000a11402f/content.h... http://help-legacy.sap.com/saphelp_erp2005/helpdata///EN/81/0bc93a5fc1093ee10000000a11402f/content.h... So something need to be activate, like here is mentioned: https://archive.sap.com/discussions/thread/1839531 https://archive.sap.com/discussions/thread/1839531 But what? Thanks for help

answers.text: Hello Benjamin,on which release are you? ERP 6.0 (as the help link indicates)?There are 2 things that need to be considered:a) Do you have the discrete industries mill products industry extension (DIMP_SDUD )activated? I know this is sometimes confused. People run SAP for Mill Products, but do not necessarily activate the industry extension on top. If you run S/4, this question is no longer relevant. b) If this is the case, you need to activate this is in the material master on the additional tab for product units of measure. Best regards, Stefan Weisenberger

data.title: Which Planning Strategy to use??

qas.question: Hello, I'm creating the customer requirements (say, for the next 3 months) using Transaction MD81 (Unlike PIR Creation using MD61) and after that, I'm going for the MRP Run. Now...I'm bit confused regarding which Planning Strategy to use (10, 20, 40, 50, etc.)?? Is it a MTS or a MTO process? Regards, Kaushik.

answers.text: Hi, In MD81 you will be giving some requirement type. You have to select the strategy which is suitable for the requirement type. You can refer the table containing assignment of strategy type with customer requirement type. http://help.sap.com/saphelp_erp60_sp/helpdata/en/cb/7f9b7043b711d189410000e829fbbd/frameset.htm http://help.sap.com/saphelp_erp60_sp/helpdata/en/cb/7f9b7043b711d189410000e829fbbd/frameset.htm Hope this will help. data.title: batch assignment at which stage?

qas.question: For batch management where is the best place to get the batch assigned. Is it at the process order creation/ save? Is it at the process order release? Is it at the confirmation of the order: is it with the confirmation parameter or with the movement type? What drives this decision in a FDA regulated chemical process industry. we are planning to use sap assigned batch no., without any intelligent number in it. Thnx!

answers.text: Hi I do not think USFDA suggests when batch # should be assigned. It purely depends on what you are doing in real time. Normally in chemical/ Pharma batch number should be assined during production order either ducring creation or release. I do not understand you last sentence " SAP assigned batch number without any intelligent number." Regards YMREDDY

data.title: Cost for the same Material Code which is produced (standard cost) and also purchased.

qas.question: Hello Friends, I use a single material code for production and in the purchase process. We have assigned a standard cost. 1) When this material is produced it takes up the standard cost defined in the system (This is fine) 2) When we use the same material code for purchasing this material (import), this again calculates the costing based on standard cost and post the difference in (stock difference gains). (We need the purchase calculation to happen based on the PO value and not on standard cost as the valuation is incorrect). Requesting for a solution. THANKS in advance.

answers.text: Hi, It is Standard beheviour - When your material have Standard Price Control (S),the system carries out all stock postings at a price defined in the material master. Now as you alreday have a material number(A) in your system with Standard Price Control which is produced, all stock postings will be with price defined in material master(A).Again same material procuring from vendor and want have some differentiation, then go for following one option:option:1-Either go for Batch management process just to differentiateoption:2-Or go for spilt valuation by having concept for maintaioning two different price for same material number. ifferentiation But as your material already created with Standard Price Control (S) and having material ledger activated, check with finanace team to havePrice Control V for same material for spilt valuation process. Price Control V for same material for spilt valuation process Cross check and do impact analysis for material number(A) as you haveruning systemand then go for spilt valuation process orcreate another material number(B) with Standard Price Control (S) which to be procured from vendor. runing system create another material number Regards, Biju K

data.title: Remocal of material which are flagged for deletion

qas.question: Hello Everyone, I have to remove all the materials which are flagged for deletion. How can i put these materials into some archiving setup. Please solve this query.

answers.text: Hi, Set the deletion flag in MM06 after copying the whole field content of MATNR in MARA. Afterwards you can run the archiving process for this materials in transaction SARA object MM_MATNR, please make sure that you COPY THE MATERIAL MASTER BY FOLLOWING THE WAY ABOVE in transaction SE16 for table MARA. go transaction SARA Type in object name MM_MATNR Create a variant Execute the archive run If successful, execute the delete run Record the number of entries deleted (Management screen). Regards, ian, Wong Loke Foong Edited by: Ian Wong on Oct 5, 2011 2:28 PM

data.title: Sales plan in PP for materials which are purchased for purpose of reselling

qas.question: Dear SAP gurus, At our company we use HR, MM, SD, FICO, PP modules, SAP ERP ECC 6.0. I am trying to find solution in SAP which which enables most basic Sales planning where I am able to make entries for target sales quantity, target sales total amount, etc. on monthly basis, on material and plant level. After some research I found that for this purpose it is best to use: #option 1 - APO (as part of SCM), #option 2 - APO Add-in for SAP ERP (ECC) or #option 3 - stick to core functionalities of SAP ERP (ECC). Since there is very little chance my company will decide for options 1 or 2, our goal is to make best of option 3! Closest I have found is this link bloghttps://blogs.sap.com/2015/08/13/sales-operations-planning/under section STANDARD SOP for Material. https://blogs.sap.com/2015/08/13/sales-operations-planning/ It seems that Sales plan is under PP module. Since we have little materials that we produce, my question is can we still make sales plan in this module, for materials which we didn't produced, instead we have purchased the for purpose of sale to other parties (reselling)? BR.Sam

answers.text: Hi Sam, Question: Question: It seems that Sales plan is under PP module. Since we have little materials that we produce, my question is can we still make sales plan in this module, for materials which we didn't produced, instead we have purchased the for purpose of sale to other parties (reselling)? You can use demand management and MRP component to plan materials that you purchase and purchase (trading goods). trading goods) You should also take into account the option of usingSAP IBP, because SAP APO will be end of support by 2025. SAP IBP SAP IBP https://help.sap.com/viewer/product/SAP_INTEGRATED_BUSINESS_PLANNING/2002/en-US https://help.sap.com/viewer/product/SAP_INTEGRATED_BUSINESS_PLANNING/2002/en-US Regards. Farid.

data.title: Population of MARD-PRCTL: Which View is used

qas.question: Hi, Can you help me to explain the difference between MARD-PRCTL and MARC-PRCTR ? I can see that MARC-PRCTR is populated from e.g.. Plant/Storagedata 2 or Sales General/Plant view, but from which view is MARD-PRCTL populated ? Cheers, Claus

answers.text: Hi Claus, The MARC table holds the Plant Data for Material in the material master. The MARD table holds the Storage Location Data for Material. The MARD table is populated when the stock level of the material is updated. So, the subsequent fields of the table including PRCTL (Profit center) gets populated when the corresponding transactions for updating the material stocks are executed. Regards, Thangesh

data.title: SAP B1 HOW TO QUERY ON FLOAT AR RESERVE INVOICES WHICH ARE NOT YET POSTED IN DELIVERY

qas.question: Hi Experts. I'm trying to query alert message which can alert the user all AR Reserve Invoice transaction floated and not yet posted in delivery. Thank you & best regards.

answers.text: SELECT T0.DocEntry, T0.DocNum FROM OINV T0 WHERE T0.CANCELED = 'N' AND T0.InvntSttus = 'O' -- delivered or not, O means not delivered AND T0.isIns = 'Y' -- reserved invoice flag. Hope this help.

data.title: which strategy to be used?

qas.question: Hi, PS module is there. But for one product client wants a different strategy. Client gets an order of say 1000 scanners to be manufactured.Client has to manufacture 300 in first 3 months, next 220 in next 3 months and 200 in next 3 months and 280 in next 3 months. Customer can increase or decrease the demand in any quarter or can ask for some quantities in next 2 months say. How to map this scenario? which strategy to be used? What extra is to maintained in material masters? Regards, Mohammad Arif.

answers.text: Hi, You can use Strategy - 40 (Planning with final assembly) You give your requirements in MD61 based on the customer schedule as 300 for the first quarter, 220 in the second quarter and so on. When there is a sale order, with an increase in the schedule qty, it gets adjusted in the next plaaning. Decrease in the sale order qty causes an increase in the plant stock whereby you can adjust in the production of the next period. Check up with the foll link: [Strategy-40|http://help.sap.com/saphelp_47x200/helpdata/en/cb/7f93e643b711d189410000e829fbbd/content.htm] In Material master, in MRP-3 view, maintain 40 for startegy type. Hope this helps.. -Thaila Shree

data.title: settlement rule of rework order which is  created by trigger point

qas.question: Hi Experts I am creating a rework order automatically with the help of standard trigger point.For this I already defined reference operation set and rework order type. I assigned trigger point to the rework operation in the routing.With this whenever we try to conform the rework operation during cor6 , rework order being created automatically.But after we enter rework qty and reference operation set , rework qty getting conformed and terminated.But I have to enter settlement rule as the case of manual rework order(co07) which is very much vital for the cost valuation of rework qty. Shall anybody give the solution why It was being terminated with out asking for settlement rule and how to solve this? Thanks in advance for the solution. full points would be rewarded if found currect solution. Thanks and regards srinivas.

answers.text: Hi , Your requirement is not clear, are you creating rework production order through CO07, or inserting the rework operation in existing production order by trigger point? When you create production order with out material then you need to give settlement rule any cost object like cost center, Production order etc, but when you trigger the rework the additional cost will incurr to original order. Regards, Anupam Sharma

data.title: Which field is the workflow trigger for a Contract Agreement ?

qas.question: Greeting everyone, I am not sure if this has been answer before or if this is the correct forum. If not, apologies in advance and do direct me to the appropriate topic/forum. I have an inquiries with regards to Contract Outline agreement and workflow trigger. Based on my company configuration, the trigger is based on the changes in value and release strategy. What I am unsure is that which field the workflow-trigger checks? What I am unsure is that which field the workflow-trigger checks? Does SAP checks the field "Target Value" in contract header, or the sum of net value in each of the contract items? Thank you

answers.text: Hello Sek, In contracts, the target value is used for the release strategy determination and not the net contract value. If you maintain a target value in the contract header, this value is set in field CEKKO-GNETW to determine the strategy. If no target value exists on header level, a cumulation of the target values of the items is carried out and used for the release strategy determination. Regards, Mauro

But supplier invoice with other Entry Type= Online, Invoice from Parking function and etc.. do not have output tab and we cannot view the form template. Only ESR type can view form template. Could you please guide us how to view the form template for supplier invoices with other entry types? data.title: which table contains user name

qas.question: Dear all, For certain travel expense(T-Code:TRIP), I would like to know who created it and checked table PTRV_HEAD, but it seems no corresponding field exist. would anyone help me? thanks, Ben Wu

answers.text: Hi Ben In the report S_AHR_61016104 there is a field in the dynamic selection created by thro which you get all the trip and the details of who has created. thanks Ashok

data.title: Programs which can trigger GLPCA table entries

qas.question: Hi SAP Community, I am looking for a complete list of programs which can trigger GLPCA table entries. I am currently in the process of running related transactions manually, but to be on the save side, I would really appreciate the feedback from you guys. Thanks in advance for your support. Cheers, Chris

answers.text: Hi, You can find the programs where the table GLPCA is being used. For this use transaction code SE11 and enter the table name GLPCA and click on the icon where used. A pop up window will be displayed and you can click on Programs only. This will display all the Programs where the table GLPCA is used including any Z programs developed in your system. Thanks Murali.

data.title: pricing updates depend on which date

qas.question: dear all price updates depend on which date. required delievry date i think but if i m changing the required delivery date what ll be the effect to others.

answers.text: Hi Subu, Yes your thinking is correct the price will be updated for the open orders based on the required delivery date. For newly creating orders system will pick the new price or changed price automatically. If you change required delivery I hope it will not effect others any way you are going to delever the open items in the future only. Recently we have changed the CST from 3% to 2% to get this updation in the open order we have changed the Required delivery date to this month. I hope it will help you, Regards, Murali.
